page.title: 21Architecture
page.content:
Broom Park was built for Dartington estate workers in the 1930's and the houses were originally let to them. Like some other houses on the estate which were low cost, they were roofed with asbestos. Almost all of them have now been sold to private buyers and a couple of the houses have been reroofed. The estate is surrounded by fields and open countryside at present.
Contribution by: Anonymous
